title: Jobs market wobbles amid global slowdown and Brexit paralysis
text:
Britain's jobs miracle could finally have run out of steam as the slowing global economy combined with Brexit paralysis pushed employment down and slowed down pay growth in the three months to August.

Unemployment rose by 22,000 to 1.3 million, while the number of people in work dropped 56,000 to 32.7 million – the biggest fall in four years, according to the Office for National Statistics.

Total pay rose by 3.8pc on the year, a healthy rise by the standards of the last decade but down on the previous month’s 3.9pc.

The number of vacancies dipped again to 813,000, indicating slowing demand to hire more workers.

Surging employment and strong growth in pay is a crucial pillar supporting the economy...
